Summarise Boxplot Statistics with Outliers

Source: R/summarise_boxplot_stats.R
summarise_boxplot_stats.Rd

Computes the five-number summary (min, Q1, median, Q3, max), interquartile range (IQR), range, and outliers for each numeric variable in a data frame or a numeric vector.

Usage

summarise_boxplot_stats(x)

Arguments

x

A numeric vector, matrix, data frame, or tibble.

Value

A tibble with columns: `variable`, `min`, `q1`, `median`, `q3`, `max`, `iqr`, `range`, `n_outliers`, `outliers`.

Examples

summarise_boxplot_stats(iris)
#> # A tibble: 4 × 10
#>   variable       min    q1 median    q3   max   iqr range n_outliers outliers 
#>   <chr>        <dbl> <dbl>  <dbl> <dbl> <dbl> <dbl> <dbl>      <int> <list>   
#> 1 Sepal.Length   4.3   5.1   5.8    6.4   7.9   1.3   3.6          0 <dbl [0]>
#> 2 Sepal.Width    2     2.8   3      3.3   4.4   0.5   2.4          4 <dbl [4]>
#> 3 Petal.Length   1     1.6   4.35   5.1   6.9   3.5   5.9          0 <dbl [0]>
#> 4 Petal.Width    0.1   0.3   1.3    1.8   2.5   1.5   2.4          0 <dbl [0]>
summarise_boxplot_stats(iris$Sepal.Width)
#> # A tibble: 1 × 10
#>   variable   min    q1 median    q3   max   iqr range n_outliers outliers 
#>   <chr>    <dbl> <dbl>  <dbl> <dbl> <dbl> <dbl> <dbl>      <int> <list>   
#> 1 value        2   2.8      3   3.3   4.4   0.5   2.4          4 <dbl [4]>
summarise_boxplot_stats(data.frame(a = c(rnorm(98), 10, NA)))
#> # A tibble: 1 × 10
#>   variable   min     q1 median    q3   max   iqr range n_outliers outliers 
#>   <chr>    <dbl>  <dbl>  <dbl> <dbl> <dbl> <dbl> <dbl>      <int> <list>   
#> 1 a        -2.61 -0.358  0.112 0.625    10 0.983  12.6          9 <dbl [9]>
